p: The FeSi and SiC formation would normally occur at >1800 °C in conventional process. Use of virgin silicones and epoxy resins has seen FeSi and SiC formations around 1500 °C [ 8]. The saved energy resources add up to 60 GJ/t as the result of plastic replacement in blast furnaces [ 4]. In EAF steelmaking, replacing ≈30 % of the coke and coal by polyethylene wastes resulted in energy savings up to ≈12 kWh/t of plastic charge [ 64]. Tyre injection trials at OneSteel’s Sydney steel mill, Australia, saw reduction in electrical energy consumption from 1.526 MJ/kg to 1.483 MJ/kg billet (0.043 MJ/kg billet savings in energy), the amount of carbon injectant reduced from 464 kg/heat to 406 kg/heat, and improved number of liquid tonnes per power-on time minute from 2.12 to 2.2 t/min [ 64].
